task.summary: Default task
Model creation speed optimizations. Biggie: swapped to fft-based convolution instead of scipy.ndimage.convolve. About 100x speedup.
Unified debug timer
Added gitignore
Updated tests
Added ability to include magnitude zeropoint
comment cleanup
readability cleanup, comments
Output residual and model files. Fixed shift bug in convolution. Replaced M_rot_inv with M_rot.T, since it's a rotation matrix.
Added several keyword options to fitting. Components must now be specified via keyword. Properly handle case when pyregion is not installed. FITS output is now optional.
Changed pyregion not-found logic.
Added plotting flag
Removed plotting flag
Fixed default iter/burn values
Renaming. ds9 call in tests also displays original file now.
Removed image data from MCMC traces. Significantly reduces the size of the pickle database
Model IVM file is now called modelivm instead of residivm
Changed naming scheme of output files
Made add_sersic and add_point_source "public". Added info to docstrings
plot more histograms when testing
Removed build dir from git
Test skips histogram plots if numpy is not installed.
Fixed bug in fft padding logic.
Moved fft padding to its own function, so it's only executed once on setup. Fixed divide by 0 bug when convolving weight map. Cleaned up fits saving when fitting.
add sersic function returns sbeff, for kicks
Added docstring to fitting function. Refactored fits output controls. Adjustments to model to find source of bad IVM convolution bug.
Added sky component for un-subtracted or poorly subtracted sky.
Renamed "tests" directory to "examples" to allow unit tests later.

Moved bad pixel masking before model definition (and into fitting.py from models.py). Speed improvements to model calculation (pre-compute ffts for psf and psf ivm, pre-compute image coordinate arrays).
Adjusted default parameters in example file.
Cleaning and speed improvements in add_sersic
Naming cleanup
Major model component system refactoring. Models are now specified using a configuration file. New ComponentBase parent class for all components.
Fixed docstring
Changed components argument of fitting to model_file
Fitting parameters saved to output FITS headers.
ModelComponents package added to setup.py
Removed debug print
Added von Mises distribution. Added ability to specify sersic angle in degrees or radians. Re-enabled masking. Removed default burn and thin settings.
Moved PSF normalization to array_utils. Summation in normalization now uses math.fsum to ensure better numeric stability.
Ensure only subclasses of ComponentBase are returned by the model parser.
Refactored saving mean model fits files. Function is now exposed so that it can be run after fitting, with subslices of the trace database (e.g. to thin or adjust the burn-in period).
bugfixes to vonmises distribution and saved header information
Fixed mean model saving (needed mean(axis=0) for xy coordinates).
Changed fitting semantics, now tries to match residual to array of zeros, with composite inverse variance map used for errors.
pixel coordinates are correctly not computed if passed to add_to_array via kwargs
Sersic speed improvements, model IVM is now model**2 convolved with PSF variance (instead of RMS)
Updated docstrings.
Added circular von mises distribution
Circular von Mises fixes
Sersic angle now defaults to radians
Cleanup in models
Refactored bad pixel masking into multicomponent_model
Added point_source_subtracted as model attribute.
Fixed masking bug, MASKING FINALLY WORKS
Updated mask fill value to bad pixel value
Changed bad pixel fill value
Fixed bug in Sersic profile SB calculation
formatting cleanup
Changed bad pixel fill value to 0. (Weight remains unchanged). Modified example model file.

Models can now provide multiple PSFs, allowing MCMC to select the most likely one. Masked regions no longer have their pixels set to a special value. Zero-weight pixels are properly propagated into the composite inverse variance map.
Unified maximum likelihood calculations. Changed header output values to 'general' numeric, ie scientific when needed.
Fixed fits header comments.
Set OBJECT keyword in header
Set OBJECT keyword in header
Set nan/inf pixels to 0 with 0 weight during fitting.
Reverted bad pixel behaviour
Fixed bug in fractional pixel calculation
Use AdaptiveMetropolis step for xy components. Use numexpr for Sersic calculations (~2x speed improvement). Re-parameterized Sersic profile as reff, reff_b instead of reff, axis_ratio
Fixed header card for reff_b
Fixed error in Sersic equation. Added pyMC Potential to Sersic to force major axis > minor axis
Sersic test script. Updated sersic kappa or b_n calculation for better approximation
Improved Sersic test script. Optimizations for Sersic calculation
Code cleanup
Code cleanup
Code cleanup
Added test for PSF component placement. Gzipped reference sersic profile file.
Problem identified for odd-sized arrays when doing fourier convolution
maximum likelihood model now just really uses the sample with the maximum likelihood (min deviance)
maximum likelihood model now just really uses the sample with the maximum likelihood (min deviance)
Skip sampling and just rewrite ML models if database exists
Fixed test output. Code cleanup in fitting.
Masking can now be done using fits file or ds9 region
FIxed import of pymc distributions
FIxed import of pymc distributions
Added Schechter distribution
Schechter distribution test (currently broken)
Ability to run multiple chains
Test Sersic profiles for multiple n values
Fixed Sersic test output
